content.description: Yode's guide says 10a at the bottom and 10c at the top. I believe the reverse is true. Definitely cruxy at the 1st two bolts, and should be led with caution
content.location: The right of the two prominent arching columns. Anchors visible above on the right facing headwall. 1st bolted line right of the obvious low roof of angle of refraction

content.description: Stem along the thin crack into an overhanging face. Mantle to reach the anchor.
content.protection: Gear to two inches. Chain anchors (shared with Spinal Column).
content.location: The crack immediately left of Spinal Column (bolted column).

content.description: A Tieton classic on an aesthetic pillar.  Boulder a few feet up a finger crack (Boy Howdy, 5.10a), then step right to clip the first bolt.  Pass a dismally thin crux at the third bolt (.11-), followed by a long, athletic reach to a jug.  Crimp up the gently overhanging face, culminating in the business: a long static reach or deadpoint to a jug.  Good edging shoes help.
content.protection: 6 bolts.  There is currently no rap anchor atop the route.  Clip a directional bolt at the top and step a few feet over to the anchor above the next route to the left (Black Celebration, 5.11a).

content.description: the crux was definitely moving on top of pillar to anchor in
content.location: next to crack up and short spectrum. small tree at base of start.

content.description: Crux is right off the deck. Lead with care.
content.location: The wide black pillar just left of the thin crack (Boy Howdy 10A) that divides this pillar from Ice Cream girls

content.description:
Start in a shallow left-facing corner with a discontinuous thin crack (stemming, 5.10-).  Before the corner disappears, at a bolt, follow good edges out and right to the hanging pillar face. The crimps get thinner and the headwall gets steeper the higher you go, with a crux pinch and a stab to a good edge.  Juggy edges and a cool mantle finish it off.

Edging shoes help.
content.protection: ~ 7 Bolts; fewer on the FA (gear used).  Belay bolts on top.  Rap and clean from chain anchor above the bolted route to the left (Spinal Column, 5.10c).
